174.article_body: Morari Bapu has taken the initiative of donating ₹1.25 crore as a means to extend help to people affected in Ukraine. Earlier, Morari Bapu's trust raised ₹19 crore for construction of Ayodhya's Ram Mandir, out of which ₹9 crore was donated by foreigners. The trust has now decided to donate ₹1.25 crore from this amount to help people in Ukraine.

175.title: Another aircraft had come in front of my plane, pilot averted head-on collision: Mamata
175.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that another aircraft had come in front of her chartered plane and it was the prompt action of the pilot that averted a head-on collision. "If the situation had continued for 10 more seconds, there would have been a head-on collision," she added. This comes two days after Mamata's chartered flight experienced mid-air turbulence.

176.title: Wait till March 10: Punjab CM Channi on exit poll predictions
176.article_body: With the exit polls predicting a win for AAP in Punjab, CM and Congress leader Charanjit Singh Channi urged the people to wait till March 10, the day when Assembly poll results will be declared. "Only boxes (EVMs) will tell what has to happen. All of you, please wait till March 10," Channi added.

177.title: CCTV footage helps independent candidate reclaim victory in TN civic polls
177.article_body: After a tie with DMK's K Subbulakshmi in Tamil Nadu urban civic polls, independent candidate R Palaniselvi questioned the draw of lots done by the Returning Officer in which Subbulakshmi was declared the winner. Palaniselvi moved the Madras High Court against the Returning Officer. On examining the CCTV footage of the counting process, the bench found Palaniselvi as the winner.

178.title: My mother-in-law dated a man 19 yrs younger than her: Rahul Mahajan
178.article_body: In a recent episode of 'Smart Jodi', contestant Rahul Mahajan said he got married secretly because he never wanted his marriage with his wife Natalya Ilina to end like his previous marriages. After a few pictures from his wedding were shown on the show, Rahul also revealed that his mother-in-law dated a guy who was 19 years younger than her.

179.title: Family said 'you are shy, don't even talk, how will you act': Actress Raashii
179.article_body: Talking about her family's reaction to her taking up acting, 'Rudra...' actress Raashii Khanna said that their first reaction was "you are so shy, you don't even talk, how will you act?" "When the trailer of Rudra came, my mother was...shocked...That's...validation I look for. My parents and my brother never gloss it up...and are my best support," she added.

180.title: Indian student in Ukraine sends pet dog to home in Rohtak with friend
180.article_body: A medical student from India, Sahil, studying in Ukraine, has reportedly sent his pet dog to his home in Rohtak before himself. Sahil sent the dog to India with his friend. He reportedly said that he would only come back to India if his pet dog comes along too. Reports said that the dog is sad without Sahil.

181.title: State govt made several efforts to contain Maoist incidents: Chhattisgarh Guv
181.article_body: Chhattisgarh Governor Anusuiya Uikey said the state government has made several efforts to contain Maoist incidents due to which development activities are reaching every part of the state. "State government's several efforts helped in effectively checking Maoist incidents. On the other hand, success has been achieved in neutralising 46 Maoists and motivating 555 ultras to surrender," Uikey added.

182.title: 5, including 8-month-old boy, charred to death in house fire in Kerala
182.article_body: Five members of a family, including an eight-month-old boy, were charred to death on Tuesday when their house caught fire in Kerala. Police said that neighbours alerted them. Attempts were made to douse the fire. However, it could not be controlled. Bikes parked at the compound of the house were also gutted in the fire.

183.title: Assam approves replacing paper ballots with EVMs in Guwahati civic polls
183.article_body: Assam Cabinet approved Guwahati Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022 for replacing paper ballots with EVMs in Guwahati civic polls. The decision was taken to "ensure transparency and efficiency in elections", CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said. "We took several important decisions pertaining to repealing of obsolete laws, revision of land premium rates...raising loan from NABARD," he tweeted.

184.title: Never easy for a woman to thrive in a world full of judgements: Sushmita
184.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen took to Instagram on the occasion of International Women's Day and stated that it can "never be easy" for a woman to thrive in a world full of judgements. "To teach it mercy, ah," added Sushmita in the post. "Whatever be the journey, it is beautiful to be a woman," the actress stated.

185.title: Require more women in force to tackle protests: K'taka DG
185.article_body: Karnataka DG and IGP Praveen Sood said the state police needs more women in its reserve forces. "We have witnessed...that women are at the forefront of protests in the state. During the hijab controversy, most of the protesters were women," Sood told Hindustan Times. He added, a new women battalion recently announced in the state budget will help ease workload.

186.title: Russia becomes world's most-sanctioned country
186.article_body: Russia has overtaken Iran to become the world's most-sanctioned country, days after its invasion of Ukraine. Since February 22, Russia has been the target of 2,778 new sanctions designations led by the US and European allies, bringing its total to 5,532, as per global database firm Castellum.AI. Iran has confronted 3,616 sanctions against it over the course of a decade.

187.title: Indian among foreigners to fight for Ukraine against Russia, pic surfaces
187.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs took to Facebook to share a picture of some of the foreigners who have volunteered to fight for Ukraine against Russia. "International Legion of Defence of Ukraine is here! A group of volunteers from USA, UK, Sweden, Lithuania, Mexico and India in Kyiv," the ministry wrote.

188.title: Ranbir looks at my childhood pics and says, 'God, you're an alien': Alia
188.article_body: Speaking about her father Mahesh Bhatt calling her a "mystery", actress Alia Bhatt said, "Ranbir says that to me all the time. And this is the first time I've heard my father say it to me." "Even when Ranbir looks at my childhood photos, he says, 'Look at your eyes. God, you're an alien. What are these eyes?'," Alia said.

189.title: 114 held in illegal arms cases in Gujarat Police's special drive in Feb
189.article_body: As many as 106 cases were lodged and 114 persons were arrested for illegal sale, smuggling, purchase, possession and production of firearms and ammunition across Gujarat in a special drive by Gujarat Police in February. The month-long drive, from February 1 to February 28, was conducted across all 33 districts of Gujarat.

190.title: Top Russian Army general killed in Ukraine
190.article_body: A top Russian Army general has been killed in fighting around Kharkiv, Ukrainian intelligence has claimed. Major General Vitaly Gerasimov, chief of staff of the 41st Army, was killed along with other senior officers. Investigative journalism agency Bellingcat said it had confirmed Gerasimov's death with a Russian source.

191.title: Zelenskyy reveals his location on Instagram, says 'I'm not hiding, not afraid of anyone'
191.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday revealed his location in Kyiv on Instagram. He put out a video from his office on Bankova Street in Kyiv, saying, "I'm not hiding. And I'm not afraid of anyone." He added, "You know we used to say, Monday is a hard day. There is war in the country, so every day is Monday."

192.title: BJP will win more seats in final results than predicted in exit polls: U'khand CM
192.article_body: Soon after the exit polls predicted an edge to BJP in the state Assembly polls, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said the party would win more seats in the final results than predicted in the exit polls. "People of Uttarakhand have shown faith in us and will form the government," Dhami added.

193.title: Czech President to award state honour to Ukraine’s Prez Zelenskyy
193.article_body: Czech Republic President Milos Zeman on Monday announced that he would award the highest state honours to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "This is because the Ukrainian President has shown courage and bravery, and although the United States offered him an evacuation, he stayed in the capital of his country, from where he is leading its defence," Zeman said.

194.title: Russia will not send conscript soldiers to fight in Ukraine: Putin
194.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that he will not send conscript soldiers to fight in Ukraine. "And there will be no additional call-up of reservists," he added in a televised address. "The fixed objectives are only carried out by professional servicemen. I'm sure they are guaranteeing security and peace for the Russian people in an effective manner," Putin further said.

195.title: Avalanche hits Himachal Pradesh's Rohli, roads blocked
195.article_body: An avalanche has hit Rohli (10 km ahead from Tindi towards Killar) in Lahaul and Spiti district of Himachal Pradesh, blocking roads, the State Emergency Operation Centre informed in an official statement. Around five-six vehicles are stuck between Rohli and Kadu Nallah and a police rescue team has already rushed to the spot to help people, the statement further added.

196.title: 28-year-old bodyguard shoots himself dead in Gurugram's Sector 83
196.article_body: A 28-year-old bodyguard, who worked as a personal security officer for clients of a private security agency, allegedly shot himself dead in Gurugram's Sector 83, police said. The victim's body was recovered from a forest area near his house, police added. "Preliminary investigation revealed, he wanted to be in a relationship with a woman...but it didn't work out," police stated.

197.title: Kerala Police seize drugs worth ₹1.5 cr, couple arrested
197.article_body: Kerala Police arrested a couple and seized 1.95 kg of MDMA worth ₹1.5 crore on Monday. According to police, the contraband was wrapped in a cloth and brought from Bengaluru in a bus. The couple, hailing from Muzhappilangad, was arrested from Kannur Plaza junction. Police also seized 67 grams of brown sugar and 7.5 grams of opium from the couple.

198.title: Alia is most talented, want her to play me in my biopic: Barkha Dutt
198.article_body: Journalist Barkha Dutt said that she wants actress Alia Bhatt to play her in her biopic. "I am not saying this because she just has a film out but I am saying this because I really think most talented actor is Alia Bhatt. I mean there's no question...range, the sheer range, the ease with which she plays everything," she added.

199.title: West Indies Tests are opportunity for us to prove a point: Joe Root
199.article_body: England Test captain Joe Root has said the three-Test series against West Indies is an opportunity for them to prove a point after their 0-4 defeat in the Ashes. "We know historically it's not an easy place for England to come and play...so it's something that we're very much looking forward to. It's a big challenge for us," Root stated.

200.title: Delhi's bus fleet crosses 7,000-mark for the first time
200.article_body: The national capital's bus fleet crossed 7,000-mark for the first time on Monday after Delhi's Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot inducted 100 new CNG buses and one electric bus into the city's bus fleet. Gahlot said over 30 lakh people used a public bus every day in February which is the highest daily ridership for Delhi's bus services since pandemic started.

201.title: Why should I hold 2nd position? My time has passed: Kapil Dev as Ashwin breaks his record
201.article_body: After Ravichandran Ashwin overtook him to become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Tests, Kapil Dev said, "It’s a great achievement especially from a guy who didn't get enough opportunities in...recent past." He added, "Had Ashwin got those opportunities...he would've crossed 434 much earlier. I'm happy for him...why should I hold [the second position] from him? My time has passed."

202.title: Ukraine suffers ₹77,000 crore in damage to infrastructure since Russian invasion
202.article_body: Ukraine has suffered about $10 billion (₹77,000 crore) in damage to infrastructure since Russia invaded the country, Infrastructure Minister Oleksander Kubrakov said on Monday. "The majority of damaged structures will be repaired in a year, and the most difficult ones – in two years," he added. Kubrakov further said that Russia is doing "all it can to prevent humanitarian corridors".

203.title: Last picture taken of Shane Warne shared by his friend
203.article_body: Shane Warne's friend Thomas Hall has shared the last photo taken of the late Australian cricket legend. The photo was taken at Thailand's Koh Samui, where Warne was holidaying. "Anybody that knew Shane knew his warmth, caring, his incredible sense of humour...his laugh...twinkle in his eye and that glare from those glowing, unnaturally white teeth," Hall wrote while paying tribute.

204.title: Warren Buffett among world's 5 richest people again as fortune hits $117 billion
204.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett's net worth has grown by over 7% this year to around $117 billion as his company's shares rallied, Bloomberg reported. The 91-year-old is now back among the world's five richest people, after falling to as low as world's 11th richest person in October. World's richest person Elon Musk's wealth has dropped by 15% this year.

205.title: Shane Warne's daughter shares pics & videos with him, says 'This can't be real life'
205.article_body: Late Australian cricketer Shane Warne's daughter Summer took to Instagram to share pictures and videos with him. She wrote, "It feels like I'm dreaming...waiting for someone to wake me up and tell me...you're okay. This can't be real life." She added, "I took our time for granted dad...I'd do anything to have more time with you on this earth."

206.title: AAP going to be national, natural replacement of Congress: Raghav Chadha
206.article_body: Following exit polls predicting AAP's majority in Punjab Assembly polls, party leader Raghav Chadha said that the party is going to be the national and natural replacement of Congress. "Exit poll results tell us that the people of Punjab have overwhelmingly voted for change...AAP is now the fastest-growing political party," Chadha said.

207.title: Harry Kane scores twice as Tottenham defeat Everton 5-0 in EPL
207.article_body: Harry Kane scored twice as Tottenham Hotspur handed Everton their third straight defeat in the Premier League. Notably, Kane's brace in their 5-0 win has moved him above Arsenal legend Thierry Henry for a sixth place on the all-time Premier League top scorers' list with 176 goals. Tottenham are placed seventh on the points table with 45 points.

208.title: KCR doesn't respect Constitution of India, wants to write his own: BJP MLA
208.article_body: BJP MLA Raghunandan Rao said Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao wants to write his own Constitution of India as the leader does not want to respect the Indian Constitution. His remark came after he and other BJP MLAs Raja Singh and Eatala Rajender were suspended from the Budget session in the Telangana Assembly.

209.title: Won't restrain BJP MLA Vijender Gupta in defamation case: Delhi HC
209.article_body: Delhi High Court on Monday refused to restrain BJP MLA Vijender Gupta from posting defamatory content on social media against Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot. "None should be prevented from expressing their opinions...on the government's transaction of business," HC added. The case pertains to the alleged irregularities in the purchase and maintenance of 1,000 low-floor DTC buses.

210.title: India reports 3,993 new COVID-19 cases, 108 deaths in last 24 hours
210.article_body: India has reported 3,993 new COVID-19 cases and 108 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 108 deaths, 49 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 59 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,15,210, and the active cases declined to 49,948.

211.title: 3 youths drown while swimming in reservoir in Pune's Daund
211.article_body: Three youths, aged 20-21, drowned in a water reservoir in Pune's Daund on Sunday, police said. "The probe so far has indicated that the three entered the water reservoir for swimming. But they got drowned," Inspector Vinod Ghuge of Daund Police Station said. The police have recovered the three bodies, and they have been sent to a hospital for post-mortem.

212.title: Free tabs only for students of classes 10-12 for now, clears Haryana govt
212.article_body: Haryana's Education Minister Kanwar Pal said the government will distribute free tablets only to students of classes 10-12 for now. Though they earlier promised to include class 8 and 9 students in the scheme, he said they would be considered later. Pal also said that tenders for tablets worth ₹620 crore have already been issued by the government.

213.title: ₹3,866 cr set aside to treat sewage in Hyd in T'gana Budget 2022-23
213.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister Harish Rao Thanneeru on Monday presented the state Budget 2022-23. Of the total ₹2,56,958 crore proposed expenditure, ₹3,866 crore will be used to treat sewage in Hyderabad. ₹1,542 crore will be spent towards the maintenance of roads in Hyderabad, Rao added. The government has set aside ₹725 crore for 'Sunkishala' drinking water project, he stated.

214.title: Troll says even Abhishek can't believe when he's offered a film, actor reacts
214.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan replied to a Twitter user who tried to troll him. The user shared a meme and took a veiled dig on the actor's career, it read, "When Abhishek gets...call from any director for a movie. You're not making a fool of me right?" Abhishek wrote with sarcasm, "Hey man! Loved your bio. 'Whatever you are...Be a good one'."

215.title: Man locks, kills wife in bathroom of rented house in Pune, booked
215.article_body: Pune Police have booked a man, Sham Dhere, for locking his wife, Ritu Dhere, in the bathroom of their house and killing her in Akurdi on Sunday. Police said that the couple was living in a rented room. Police added that woman's body was found in bathroom that had been locked from outside. Case under Section 302 has been registered.

216.title: Russia declares ceasefire in 5 Ukraine cities including Kyiv for evacuation of civilians
216.article_body: Russia on Tuesday declared a ceasefire amid the ongoing war in Ukraine from 10 am Moscow time (12.30 pm IST) to provide humanitarian corridors for the evacuation of civilians in the cities of Kyiv, Chernihiv, Sumy, Kharkiv and Mariupol, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Russia said. The development comes following the third round of talks between Russia and Ukraine.

217.title: Participation of citizens must to improve air quality: Environment Minister
217.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav stressed the importance of citizens' participation in improving air quality. "Dust management, solid waste management, open waste burning, industrial and vehicular pollution are...key factors that need to be addressed for improving air quality," he said during 'Interactive Dialogue Towards Clean Air' organised by Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM).

218.title: Fire breaks out at fireworks factory in Tamil Nadu, 1 dead
218.article_body: A fire broke out at a fireworks manufacturing unit in Virudhunagar district of Tamil Nadu on Monday. According to the district administration, one person died while another suffered burn injuries in the incident. Earlier, in January this year, four people were killed in a similar fire accident in a firecracker unit in the district.

219.title: MMB floats tender for new jetty, terminal facilities at Mumbai's Radio club
219.article_body: In a move to decongest the existing jetties at the Gateway of India, the Maharashtra Maritime Board floated a tender for the construction of a passenger jetty and terminal facilities at Mumbai's Radio club in Colaba. It is expected to cost ₹80 crore to be completed and the Central and state government will have an equal share in the expenditure.

220.title: Bengaluru sees less than 100 COVID-19 cases; positivity rate at 0.86%
220.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 97 new COVID-19 cases as compared to 146 new cases reported on Sunday, according to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) data. The city also reported three coronavirus-related deaths in the last 24 hours. The daily COVID-19 positivity rate in Bengaluru dropped to 0.86% as compared to 0.9% reported on Sunday, the data showed.

221.title: Would he want break from IPL? BCB President on Shakib's request for break
221.article_body: After Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan requested pulling out of their upcoming tour of South Africa, stating that he can't play so much international cricket, BCB President Nazmul Hasan questioned Shakib's commitment to the national side. "Would he have said the same thing if he was picked in the IPL?" asked Nazmul. "It's surprising, to be honest," he added.

222.title: Ukrainian soldier proposes to his girlfriend at checkpoint amid war, video goes viral
222.article_body: A video of a Ukrainian soldier proposing to his girlfriend after stopping her at checkpoint amid war with Russia went viral. In the video, the troops can be seen questioning a group of people, who have placed their hands on a car's roof. The soldier gets down on one knee and surprises her with a ring as she turns around.

223.title: Safe corridor for our students in Ukraine's Sumy didn't materialise: India to UNSC
223.article_body: Addressing the UNSC on the humanitarian situation in Ukraine, India's UN Ambassador TS Tirumurti reiterated the urgent demand for the safe and uninterrupted passage for all civilians, including Indians stranded in Ukraine. He said India is deeply concerned that despite its repeated urgings to both Russia and Ukraine, the safe corridor for students stranded in Sumy did not materialise.

224.title: Better.com, that fired 900 staff on Zoom, plans laying off 4,000 this week: Report
224.article_body: Three months after Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg fired 900 workers on a Zoom call, the US-based mortgage company is planning to lay off around 4,000 people this week, TechCrunch reported citing sources. That is about 50% of its staff of about 8,000. Following the December layoffs, Garg apologised, saying that he "blundered the execution" and took time off.

225.title: Man tries to sodomise 8-yr-old boy in Guj, drowns him in river; held
225.article_body: A man has been arrested for forcibly drowning an eight-year-old boy in Gujarat. "He abducted the victim after luring him with promises of buying a...toy...accused then took the child to banks of Mahisagar river...tried to sodomise him...the child started crying...the accused...forcibly drowned him in the Mahisagar river," police said. Police added that the boy had gone missing on March 2.

226.title: Indian Embassy praises its driver for injured student's 700 km transit in Ukraine
226.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Ukraine has tweeted, "Kudos to Indian Embassy driver who successfully transferred Harjot over 700km from Kyiv to Bodomierz border under dangers of shelling and constraints of fuel shortage, road blocks, detours and traffic jams." Harjot, who sustained bullet injuries in Kyiv, was taken by road so that he can board an evacuation flight to return home.

227.title: Initially people used to say I don't look like a heroine: Madhuri
227.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit spoke about the time when people used to question if she can become a successful actor. Madhuri said, "People used to say that I don't look like a heroine because I was a very young girl from the Maharashtrian root, very petite." "My mother...[used to say] you do good work and you will get recognition," she added.

228.title: 5 held in Pune for kidnapping, threatening to kill youth over loan money
228.article_body: Pune Police arrested five people within four hours after they allegedly kidnapped youth from a petrol pump on Pune-Solapur highway. Police found victim had borrowed ₹20,000 from an accused and had returned ₹15,000. However, accused allegedly demanded ₹1 lakh more, which led to dispute. Accused then kidnapped victim and threatened to kill him if he did not pay ₹1 lakh.

229.title: Sisodia inaugurates health clinics in 20 Delhi government schools
229.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM and Education Minister Manish Sisodia on Monday inaugurated health clinics called Aam Aadmi School Clinics (AASC) in 20 government schools across the national capital. "An extension of the mohalla clinics...AASC will have a psychologist along with the doctor to examine and look over the mental and physical well-being of the students," Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain tweeted.

230.title: Gurugram civic body worker beats salon staff over wife's makeup, suspended
230.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has suspended a junior engineer for allegedly beating, abusing and threatening the staff of a salon in sector 38 on Friday. The man reportedly created ruckus at the salon after his wife expressed disappointment over the makeup done by the staff. Police said the man also left the salon without paying ₹5,000 for service.

231.title: Wanted top Maoist leader Kanchan Da, his aide arrested from Assam
231.article_body: Police have arrested the most wanted and top Maoist leader Kanchan Da and his aide from Assam's Cachar district. The 72-year-old leader was arrested along with Akash Orang from the Patimara tea garden based on information the police had received, ANI reported. A laptop, mobile phone, other devices, Maoist literature and ₹3.60 lakh were recovered from them.

232.title: 4-laning of Mumbai-Goa highway to be completed by May 2023
232.article_body: Four-laning of the Mumbai-Goa highway will be completed by May 2023, said Maharashtra PWD Minister Ashok Chavan. "Over 67% of the widening work on the 11 packages have been completed. However, work on four portions between Indapur-Vadpale, Parshuram Ghat-Adavali, Adavali-Sangameshwar and Sangameshwar-Lanja is stuck," Chavan said. Work on the 471-kilometre-long project had started in 2011.

233.title: SC directs 6 banks to release ₹1,200 cr for stalled Amrapali projects
233.article_body: The Supreme Court has ordered six banks to release ₹1,200 crore before March 14 to aid the National Buildings Constructions Corporation (NBCC) in completing Amrapali's stalled projects. Bank of Baroda, the consortium's lead bank, told SC that it has already infused its share of ₹300 crore. NBCC said it'll also be conducting an independent structural audit of Amrapali's under-construction projects.

234.title: Surveys don't matter, SP will get a majority in UP: Akhilesh
234.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday dismissed pre-poll surveys that showed an edge to the BJP in the Uttar Pradesh elections. "Let them show whatever they have got. We are winning with a majority," he said. The SP-led alliance will form the next government in Uttar Pradesh with over 300 seats, Akhilesh claimed.

235.title: TMC 'goons' tried to attack my convoy: West Bengal BJP chief
235.article_body: West Bengal BJP president Sukanta Majumdar has claimed some alleged TMC "goons" tried to attack his convoy at Mathurapur in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district on Monday. "TMC still thinks that they can stop BJP by such attacks. I assure them they would fail in their attempts," Sukanta said. "We will not stop," he added.

236.title: Priyanka to lead Cong's all-female march in Lucknow tomorrow
236.article_body: The Congress will take out an all-female march in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on International Women's Day on Tuesday. Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will lead the march, party's national spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said on Sunday. All women office-bearers of the party and others will take part in it, Supriya said.

237.title: Poor, middle class benefitted from 'Jan Aushadhi Kendras': PM Modi
237.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said the poor and middle class have benefitted from the 'Jan Aushadhi Kendras' set up to provide generic drugs at affordable prices. He also interacted with the beneficiaries and took feedback from them. "These centres are not just government stores but are becoming solution centres for the common man," PM Modi said.

238.title: Sadikali Shihab Thangal chosen as IUML's new Kerala president
238.article_body: Syed Sadikali Shihab Thangal has been chosen as the new Kerala state president of the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML). He has also been named as the chairman of the National Political Advisory Committee of the IUML. The development comes a day after former state president Hyderali Shihab Thangal passed away at the age of 74.

239.title: Free rides on buses, i-buses for Indore women on Women's Day
239.article_body: Women in Madhya Pradesh's Indore will be allowed to travel free of cost in city buses and i-buses on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. Municipal Commissioner Pratibha Pal said that "Atal Indore City Transport Services Limited is providing this gift to women for one day". Concerned officials have been instructed to provide the service to all women.

240.title: Trilogy on Shivaji Maharaj delayed due to pandemic: Nagraj
240.article_body: Filmmaker Nagraj Manjule has said his multilingual trilogy on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj is facing delays due to the COVID-19 pandemic but has not been put on the back burner. "We lost two years...so naturally we could not take it on floors," he said. "Once everything falls into place, you will know," he added.

241.title: Filmmaker Priyadarshan felicitated with honorary doctorate: Report
241.article_body: Filmmaker Priyadarshan was reportedly conferred an honorary doctorate on Monday. He was felicitated by the Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science in Chennai. However, the filmmaker is yet to officially announce this. Priyadarshan last directed Hindi film 'Hungama 2' which premiered on an OTT platform. The film starred Shilpa Shetty and Paresh Rawal in lead roles.

242.title: Woman survives after falling from 5th floor of high-rise in Ujjain
242.article_body: A woman survived after falling from the fifth floor of a high-rise building in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Saturday. Sushmita Yadav had reportedly fallen on a guava tree and was rushed to hospital by some students. Yadav, who is an employee of a private company Profit-mart located in the building, is currently out of danger, according to doctors.

243.title: Women police personnel to manage traffic in MP on Women's Day
243.article_body: Women police personnel will be handling traffic management across Madhya Pradesh along with their male counterparts on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. The initiative is aimed at boosting confidence and self-esteem of women and to convey the message that they can work shoulder-to-shoulder with men, state Home Minister Dr Narottam Mishra said.

244.title: Will be clear on March 10: Cong leader on AAP leading in Punjab
244.article_body: Responding to early exit polls showing Aam Aadmi Party forming the government in Punjab, Congress leader Sunil Jakhar said that the situation will be clear on March 10. As per the ABP C-Voter exit poll, AAP is ahead in Punjab and is projected to get 51-61 seats in the 117-member Assembly. The ruling Congress is projected to get 22-28 seats.

245.title: 'The Kashmir Files' is about right to justice: Vivek Agnihotri
245.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has said his new film 'The Kashmir Files' is about the right to justice. "They [Pandit community] don't want to speak about their pain, and it's difficult to make them speak their heart out," he said. "We got testimonials from people across the globe," he added. Vivek said he plans to make 'The Delhi Files' after this.

246.title: T'gana to set up 1st women’s university, district medical colleges
246.article_body: The Telangana government on Monday announced the setting up of the first women's university in the state and also said that they will establish a medical college in every district over the next two years. During his budget speech, Finance Minister of Telangana Harish Rao said that the government has initiated measures to introduce English medium in all the schools.

247.title: Never understood the game: Swami Chakrapani on 'Lock Upp' eviction
247.article_body: After his eviction from 'Lock Upp', Swami Chakrapani has said he never quite understood the game. "I am a man who lives in solitude. I have never been put under the same roof along with so many people," he said. "Honestly, it was a surprise to me when I saw people...fighting to be seen," he added.

248.title: 1,314 Indians evacuated today from Ukraine’s neighbouring countries
248.article_body: Over 1,300 Indians were evacuated today from Ukraine's neighbouring countries by seven special civilian flights. Out of the seven flights, four landed in New Delhi, while two reached Mumbai. There were five flights from Budapest and one each from Bucharest and Suceava. More than 17,400 Indians have been brought back since February 22, according to the Ministry of Civil Aviation.

249.title: It's been a sad week: Steve Smith on deaths of Warne, Marsh
249.article_body: Following deaths of Australian cricket legends Rod Marsh and Shane Warne last week, Australia Test vice-captain Steve Smith said it was a "sad week". Warne, aged 52, died due to a suspected heart attack on Friday. Marsh, aged 74, also passed away on same day after suffering a heart attack eight days earlier. "We feel for both...Marsh...Warne family," he added.

250.title: Cong leader holds protest urging KCR to re-install Ambedkar statue
250.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao on Monday staged a protest at the Telangana Martyrs' Memorial to urge the state government to re-install the Bhimrao Ambedkar statue at Panjagutta crossroads. Rao said that CM KCR should install the statue where it was vandalised in 2019. This comes a month after minister KT Rama Rao assured a 125-feet-tall Ambedkar statue in Hyderabad.

251.title: Body of Shane Warne transferred to Bangkok before flight to Australia
251.article_body: The body of Australian spin legend Shane Warne has been transported to Thailand's capital Bangkok before being flown back to Australia. The convoy of ambulance and police drove overnight from Surat Thani province, south of Thailand, to an airport in Bangkok. Warne passed away aged 52 at a villa on the resort island of Koh Samui.

252.title: BJP will return with a full majority in Goa: CM Pramod Sawant
252.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Monday said that BJP will return with a full majority in the state. "BJP will get 18-22 seats...and will form the government. I strongly believe people will once again choose...double engine government," said Sawant. He added that their priority was to complete the infrastructure projects and they'll fulfil the 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat Swayampurna Goa' scheme.

253.title: Medvedev won't be tennis-wise affected by Russia-Ukraine war: Mouratoglou
253.article_body: Serena Williams' coach Patrick Mouratoglou said world number one Daniil Medvedev won't get affected "tennis-wise" by ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. "On a personal or emotional side he might be, but...don't think it's going to affect his level of play," he added. The Russian overtook Novak Djokovic to top ATP rankings for first time in his career last week.

254.title: 4 directors of TN-based firm's held for cheating people of ₹1,100 cr
254.article_body: Four directors of a Tamil Nadu-based firm were arrested by the ED for defrauding people of over ₹1,100 crore. Disc Assets Lead India Limited and Ors collected the money from public in 'Collective Investment Scheme', reportedly promising land or money with higher interest in return. The accused were identified as N Umashankar, N Arun, V Janarthanan and A Saravana Kumar.

255.title: Hundreds attend funeral of 19-yr-old killed in J&K grenade attack
255.article_body: Hundreds of people attended the funeral of 19-year-old Rafiya Jan, who was killed due to a grenade blast in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, on Sunday. The incident reportedly took place when Jan was shopping with her mother and sister at the Amira Kadal market. The Hazratbal area resident succumbed to her multiple fatal injuries in the SMHS hospital during treatment.

256.title: 501 trees planted in MSRVVP under Ankur Abhiyan in MP's Ujjain
256.article_body: Various institutions' members and volunteers planted 501 saplings under the Ankur Abhiyan at Maharshi Sandipani Rashtriya Vedavidya Pratishthan (MSRVVP) in MP's Ujjain. The programme was inaugurated with the molshree tree, said to cure throat cancer, being planted. The trees were provided by Vasundhara Hariyali Mahotsav committee and would be looked after by gurukul students on a daily basis.

257.title: Dead, benign: Steve Smith on Rawalpindi pitch after 925 runs scored in 4 days of 1st Test
257.article_body: Reacting to 925 runs being scored and just 11 wickets taken after four days in the first Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi, Steve Smith called the pitch "pretty benign" and "dead". "I thought it would break up a little bit more and probably turn a bit more from the start, but it probably hasn't done so," he added.

258.title: Want to contribute in every way possible: Sneh on win vs Pak in Women's WC
258.article_body: India all-rounder Sneh Rana, who scored an unbeaten 53 and took 2/27 in her side's 107-run win against Pakistan in 2022 Women's ODI World Cup, said she wants to contribute to the team in every way possible. "Today [on Sunday] I did it somewhere," she added. Sneh and Pooja Vastrakar stitched a 122-run seventh-wicket stand, helping India post 244/7.

259.title: 1 constable injured in IED blast in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
259.article_body: A district force constable was injured in an improvised explosive device (IED) blast in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur on Monday. The constable had accidentally stepped on a pressure IED while removing naxal banners, a police official said, adding, he has been admitted to a hospital and is stable. Last month, four CRPF personnel were injured in an IED blast in Bijapur.

260.title: 2, including a woman, arrested for brandishing pistols online in MP
260.article_body: Two youths, including a woman, were arrested for brandishing pistols on social media in MP's Ujjain. The two people were arrested from Vikramnagar Bridge after the woman, a student, allegedly posted a picture of herself posing with illegal firearms in both hands on Instagram to prove herself as a lady don. Her neighbour was also apprehended for providing her weapons.

261.title: Liquor prices hiked by up to ₹80 at TASMAC shops by Tamil Nadu govt
261.article_body: Tamil Nadu has increased the price of liquor at Tamil Nadu State Marketing Corporation Limited (TASMAC) shops and the hike ranges from a minimum of ₹10 to ₹80. Now, a 180 ml bottle of rum and brandy will cost ₹130 as compared to its earlier price of ₹120. The price of beer per bottle has been increased by ₹10.

262.title: Assam court directs police to register case against CM Himanta
262.article_body: A local court in Guwahati directed the police to book a case against Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma over a Congress MP's complaint. A complaint alleging that the CM made inflammatory remarks over an eviction drive was lodged by Lok Sabha MP Abdul Khaleque. He reportedly approached court after the Dispur Police station didn't register an FIR against Sarma.

263.title: Keep Saturdays free, address grievances of tax assessees: FM to CBDT, CBIC officials
263.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman rapped CBDT and CBIC for allegedly not responding to grievances of tax assessees and directed officials to reserve Saturdays to hold meetings with them. "Are you engaging with your own assessees?...Engage with them and give the clarification required," Sitharaman said. She was having a post-budget interaction with industry members and tax officers in Bengaluru.

264.title: Accounting firms EY, Deloitte sever links with Russia
264.article_body: EY and Deloitte on Monday said they will sever ties with Russia, following two other of the world's Big Four accounting firms KPMG and PwC. EY won't serve any Russian government clients, state-owned enterprises or sanctioned entities, individuals, the firm said. "We'll separate our practice in Russia, Belarus from the global network of member firms," said Deloitte CEO Punit Renjen.

265.title: Airlines urge govt to raise cap on domestic fares citing rising fuel prices
265.article_body: Airlines in India have urged the Civil Aviation Ministry to raise caps on domestic fares citing rising aviation turbine fuel (ATF)  prices. ATF, one of the biggest components of air fares, has risen 26.4% or ₹19,508.25/kl in Delhi since December 15. The Civil Aviation Ministry had temporarily set upper and lower airfare limits in the wake of the pandemic.

266.title: Gavaskar clarifies remark on Warne, says 'That wasn't the time for any comparison'
266.article_body: After facing criticism for comparing Shane Warne with other spinners following the ex-Australian cricketer's death, Sunil Gavaskar has issued clarification. Gavaskar said, "I was asked...whether Warne was the greatest spinner ever and I gave my personal, honest opinion. In hindsight, that question shouldn't have been asked nor should have been answered. That wasn't the time for any comparison."

267.title: Can't behave like a Zara store: Delhi govt defends prohibiting discounts on liquor
267.article_body: Delhi government on Monday defended its decision to discontinue discounts on liquor in the Delhi High Court while mentioning that it was becoming an "export centre" of liquor for states like Haryana and Uttar Pradesh. The advocate representing the government said, "This is alcohol. There's some responsibility and restraint. You can't behave as if it is a Zara store.”

268.title: Govt's duty to evacuate Indians without 'partisan propaganda': Cong
268.article_body: Congress on Monday said that it is the duty of the Centre to make all efforts to evacuate Indian citizens from Ukraine without "partisan propaganda". "We remain gravely concerned about the safety of thousands of Indian students and citizens trapped in war zones," Congress said. Loss of human lives, "mass exodus of people" is unacceptable, Congress further said.

269.title: Foreign Ministers of Ukraine, Russia to meet in Turkey on March 10
269.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and his Ukrainian counterpart, Dmytro Kuleba will hold their first potential talks in Turkey's Antalya on March 10, confirmed Turkish Foreign Minister, Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu. "We especially hope this meeting is an important step towards peace, stability," said Çavuşoğlu. Meanwhile, over 400 civilians were killed in Ukraine since Russian invasion on February 24.

270.title: Russia issues list of nations that commit 'unfriendly' actions, US & UK included
270.article_body: Russia has approved a list of nations and territories that commit "unfriendly" actions against it. These include US, Canada, EU states, UK (including Jersey, Anguilla, British Virgin Islands, Gibraltar), Ukraine, Montenegro, Switzerland, Albania, Andorra, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Monaco, Norway, San Marino, North Macedonia, Japan, South Korea, Australia, Micronesia, New Zealand, Singapore, Taiwan.

271.title: Glamorgan share Viv Richards' pic from his last one-day match to mark his 70th birthday
271.article_body: English county side Glamorgan took to Twitter to share a throwback picture of Viv Richards on occasion of his 70th birthday. In the picture, Richards can be seen sitting on the floor of the dressing room seemingly exhausted after his last one-day match. Viv Richards scored an unbeaten 46 against Kent, helping Glamorgan win the tournament on September 19, 1993.

272.title: 6 workers trapped after roof of coal mine collapses in Telangana
272.article_body: As many as six workers are trapped after the roof of an underground coal mine collapsed in Telangana's Peddapalli district. The roof of the mine collapsed when workers were extracting coal in the Ramagundam region, which is a part of the Adriyala longwall project, the reports said. Security personnel have reached the spot and rescue operations are underway.

273.title: Sandalwood trees stolen from Bhopal railway magistrate's bungalow
273.article_body: Sandalwood trees were reportedly stolen by a group of burglars from the Bhopal railway special magistrate’s bungalow on Monday. The Government Railway Police said that they were informed about unusual sounds from the bungalow at around 3 am following which they arrived at the scene but were unable to find anyone. A case has been registered against unknown persons.

274.title: EU to discuss Ukraine's membership bid soon: European Council chief
274.article_body: European Union (EU) leaders will discuss Ukraine's membership bid in the coming days, European Council chief Charles Michel said on Monday. Notably, Presidents of Lithuania, Latvia, Poland and five other countries have urged expedited EU candidate country status for Ukraine following the Russian invasion. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed an application to join the EU last month.

275.title: Ukraine's Yastremska to donate Lyon prize money to help her war-torn country
275.article_body: Ukraine's Dayana Yastremska said she would donate her Lyon Open runner-up prize money (€14,545) to her home country to aid efforts following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The world number 103 lost to eighth-seeded Shuai Zhang 6-3, 3-6, 4-6 in final. Yastremska fled Ukraine with her younger sister with help from their parents days after invasion began on February 24.

276.title: I'd sell & buy metal scrap: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal while sharing an old picture
276.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Monday tweeted an old picture of him while revealing some details about his earlier days. He wrote, "I rented an 8 ft by 9 ft office in Bhoiwada (metal market) in Kalvadevi where I'd work day-in, day-out." He added, "I would sell and buy metal scrap collected from cable companies, and Bihar, my hometown."

277.title: At least 2 soldiers, 2 UN forces killed in separate attacks in Mali
277.article_body: Malian army and the UN mission in the country said at least two soldiers and two UN peacekeeping forces were killed in separate attacks on Monday. While the soldiers were attacked in the Gao region by militants, an improvised-explosive device (IED) blast hit the convoy of UN mission. This comes as Mali has been fighting Islamist insurgency for decades.

278.title: Never thought I would undergo liposuction: Amy Schumer
278.article_body: Actress-comedian Amy Schumer said she underwent liposuction and added that she never thought she would do anything like that. "Like when I would hear 'liposuction', I was just like, 'that's so crazy to me'," she stated. However, Amy decided to go for the procedure after turning 40 and having a C-section. Amy had also battled endometriosis and underwent surgery.

279.title: Dhanraj Pillay inaugurates astroturf hockey field at INS Shivaji
279.article_body: Former hockey captain Dhanraj Pillay inaugurated the astroturf hockey field at the country's premier marine engineering training institute, INS Shivaji, in Lonavala. Along with Pillay, Navy veteran and hockey coach, Avtar Singh, also inaugurated the astroturf field. Later, a match was played that featured current and former hockey players.

280.title: 'F*** off & go home, Putin', says actress Megan at Spirit Awards; video surfaces
280.article_body: During the Spirit Awards ceremony held on Sunday, host Megan Mullally said, "I think we speak for everyone here when we say we are hoping for a quick and peaceful resolution (in Ukraine)." She added, "Specifically, f*** off and go home, Putin." Her husband and co-host Nick Offerman said, "That is the quick and peaceful resolution we're talking about."

281.title: Poland to set up $1.75 billion fund to help refugees from Ukraine
281.article_body: Poland has approved a draft bill for creating a fund of $1.75 billion to help war refugees from Ukraine. The legislation seeks to allow funding of food, temporary lodging, as well as allowing refugees to legally work there. According to the UN, over 1.7 million people have fled Ukraine following Russian invasion, the majority of whom have arrived in Poland.

282.title: Best employers don't support bloodshed: Ukraine to Amazon Founder Bezos
282.article_body: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has written an open letter to Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos urging him to suspend provisions of Amazon Web Services in Russia amid war. "I believe that the best employers...would never support bloodshed and disinformation," Fedorov said. He also wrote that many Ukrainians are working for Amazon globally and they need the company's support today.

283.title: My father said 'Shane Warne can't die, it's Warnie': Brett Lee
283.article_body: Former Australia fast bowler Brett Lee said that he was at his parents' place when he came to know about Shane Warne's demise through former England spinner Graeme Swann. "When I told my dad, he summed it beautifully, he said, 'Warnie can't die. It's Warnie.'" Warne passed away at age of 52 in Thailand.

284.title: They're easy as they're poor: Brazil politician's remarks on Ukrainian women go viral
284.article_body: A Brazil politician's comments on fleeing Ukrainian women, as heard on leaked audio, are going viral. Arthur do Val said, "I’ve never seen anything like it in terms of beautiful girls. The refugee queue…just total goddesses…The queue outside Brazil’s best nightclub...doesn't come close to the refugee queue here. He added, "Let me tell you, they're easy because they're poor."

285.title: MP woman consumes poison after police try to remove encroachment
285.article_body: A woman in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar, who allegedly ran a kiosk on government property, consumed a poisonous substance after police reportedly arrived with JCB machine to remove the encroachment. She was taken to the hospital where she is said to be out of danger. Dhar tehsildar, Vinod Rathore, said the department had earlier issued notice to her following locals' complaints.

286.title: Biggest threat to Test cricket are dead pitches: Jaffer on Rawalpindi Test
286.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has taken a dig at Rawalpindi pitch being used in ongoing first Test between Pakistan and Australia. "Biggest threat to Test cricket are dead pitches. Dead pitch = dead game," he tweeted. Pakistan declared their first innings at 476/4. In reply, Australia have scored 449/7 and trail by 27 runs heading into fifth and final day.

287.title: SL will take time to bridge Test cricket gap between them, India: Gambhir
287.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said it'll take a long time for Sri Lanka to bridge the gap between them and India in Test cricket as India have been dominating. He stated that long time ago there wasn't much difference when India and Sri Lanka used to play in subcontinent. Sri Lanka lost first Test by an innings and 222 runs against India.

288.title: 'Sa Re Ga Ma Pa' host Aditya Narayan quits show after 15 yrs, says 'time flies'
288.article_body: Actor-singer Aditya Narayan has said he will no longer host the singing reality show 'Sa Re Ga Ma Pa', ending his 15-year association with the show. Saying that he was bidding adieu to the show "with a heavy heart", Narayan added, "From an 18-year-old teenager to a young man with a beautiful wife and baby daughter!...Time really does fly."

289.title: Fully grown Snow Leopard spotted in Spiti Valley in rare sighting; ITBP shares video
289.article_body: A fully grown Snow Leopard was spotted by Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) troops in Himachal Pradesh's Spiti Valley at 12,500 feet. Sharing the video of the sighting on Twitter, ITBP's official Twitter handle tweeted, "Rare sight of a rare species." It added, "ITBP is committed to preserve and restore flora and fauna in the Himalayan region."

290.title: 163 Karnataka students still stuck in Ukraine: State govt
290.article_body: The Karnataka government on Monday said 476 students have returned from Ukraine, while at least 163 are still stranded. "On 51 flights under Operation Ganga, 476 students from the state have returned. There are some students who are in Mumbai. Another five to six flights are scheduled today," said Karnataka State Disaster Management Authority Commissioner Manoj Rajan.

291.title: Activision Blizzard sued for wrongful death of female employee
291.article_body: The parents of 32-year-old Activision Blizzard employee Kerri Moynihan are suing the company for her wrongful death. Moynihan was found dead in a hotel room at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel in 2017. Her parents alleged the "hostile, intimidating, offensive, and abusive" workplace she experienced was a "significant factor" that contributed to her suicide, The Washington Post reported.

292.title: Need to check who’s arriving: PM on entry of Ukraine refugees in UK
292.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Monday rejected calls to ease visa restrictions on Ukrainians fleeing Russian invasion of their country, citing need to maintain checks on who's arriving in UK. "We're a...generous country. What we want though is control," he said. His remarks come after France accused UK of turning away 150 Ukrainians who wanted to join their families there.

293.title: Bengal Guv physically assaulted by TMC leaders in Assembly: Suvendu
293.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Monday alleged that West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar was physically assaulted by TMC leaders on the first day of the Budget Session. "We'll meet Governor. He should take appropriate action against it. If necessary, will consult with [Centre]," Suvendu added. A ruckus erupted in the Assembly after the Opposition protested against violence in municipal polls.

294.title: The Batman was phenomenal, Zoe is Catwoman of dreams: Taylor Swift
294.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, singer Taylor Swift has said that actress Zoe Kravitz, who plays Selina Kyle in 'The Batman', is the Catwoman of dreams. "The Batman was phenomenal," Taylor further wrote. Actor Robert Pattinson portrays the role of Bruce Wayne, who is the Batman in the film. 'The Batman' is directed by Matt Reeves.

295.title: Alliance with SP will depend on circumstances: Priyanka Vadra
295.article_body: Congress National General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has said that an alliance with Samajwadi Party in Uttar Pradesh will depend on circumstances. "We are waiting for the results and will make the decision according to the situation," she said. Speaking about Congress' chances of forming the government in UP, Gandhi said that Congress has "good chances in all the states."

296.title: Robbers escape with cash, jewels worth ₹6 cr from bank in K'taka
296.article_body: Unidentified persons broke into the District Central Cooperative Bank at Murgod in Karnataka and escaped with cash and valuables worth ₹6 crores on Saturday night, the police said. "We are probing the case. There was no forced entry into the bank and the lockers were not broken. They used keys to open it," a police officer said.

297.title: Over 400 civilians killed, 801 injured in Ukraine: UN
297.article_body: Office of UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) said 406 civilians were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24 as of Sunday midnight. UN human rights office added that 801 residents were injured in Ukraine so far. However, OHCHR said the real figures might be considerably higher "especially in government-controlled territory and especially in recent days".

298.title: Disclose AGM voting results within 24 hours: SEBI to Dish TV
298.article_body: SEBI has ordered Dish TV to disclose the voting results of its annual general meeting (AGM), held on December 30, in the next 24 hours. It also issued show cause notices and ordered depositories to freeze Demat accounts of the company's directors and compliance officer. Dish TV didn't disclose AGM voting results citing a pending case in the Bombay HC.

299.title: Empty seats speak loudly: Ukrainian envoy as Russia skips ICJ hearing
299.article_body: Russia on Monday skipped a hearing at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) where Ukraine has appealed for an immediate halt on Moscow's invasion. Ukrainian envoy Anton Korynevych said, "The fact that Russia's seats are empty speaks loudly. They are not here in this court of law- they are on a battlefield waging an aggressive war against my country."

300.title: BJP MLAs create ruckus during Governor's address in WB Assembly
300.article_body: BJP MLAs created ruckus during Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar's address in the West Bengal Assembly on Monday over alleged rigging in the civic elections. The incident's video shows them raising 'Jai Shri Ram' and 'Bharat Mata ki Jai' slogans during the Governor's inaugural address to the House. The governor was seen pleading with the MLAs to allow the proceedings to start.

301.title: Over 2.6 lakh Ukrainians escaped to Romania since Russia invaded
301.article_body: The police officials at the Ukraine-Romania border said a total of 2,61,445 Ukrainians have escaped to Romania since Russian invasion of the country on February 24. The officials added the residents entered Romania through its land border checkpoints with Ukraine and Moldova. Reportedly, out of the total citizens who had fled Ukraine, 1,82,312 lakh have already left Romania.

302.title: MP newspaper owner Pyare Miyan gets life imprisonment for raping minors
302.article_body: A court in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Monday sentenced newspaper owner Pyare Miyan to life imprisonment for raping minor girls. The Afkar daily owner, who is aged around 70, was arrested from Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar in July 2020. Police had found some minor girls in an unconscious state on the outskirts of Bhopal, following which he was booked.

303.title: My vulnerabilities are my strength, not weakness: Shruti Haasan
303.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan has said that her vulnerabilities are her strength and not her weakness. Shruti added that women tend to project strength or wear an armour of humour during their vulnerabilities. "You have to wake up and feel stronger than appear stronger than your feeling," she stated. Shruti said she did that to herself for a long period.

304.title: 45th Chennai Book Fair concludes, books worth ₹12 crore sold
304.article_body: The 45th Chennai Book Fair that was being held at YMCA grounds, Nandanam, concluded on Sunday. The 19-day long fair recorded a footfall of 15 lakh people and the sale of books worth ₹12 crore, Booksellers and Publishers Association of South India (BAPASI) said. The fair had 800 stalls, including those set up to promote Tamil Nadu government’s education-at-doorstep scheme.

305.title: Harjot Singh, shot at 4 times in Ukraine, brought back to India; video surfaces
305.article_body: Delhi's Harjot Singh, who was shot at four times in Ukraine's Kyiv, was brought back to India on Monday, onboard an IAF flight. Union Minister VK Singh said that Harjot's condition is stable and that he is referred to RR hospital for treatment. A video showed Harjot being assisted off the aircraft after arriving at the Hindon Airport in Ghaziabad.

306.title: US Airbnb host takes over 2,000 videos & pics of guests having sex via hidden camera
306.article_body: A 54-year-old Airbnb host in the US has been charged for allegedly spying on guests having sex and recording over 2,000 videos and photos for a year. As per the police, a guest found the hidden camera, which was disguised as a power adapter. Meanwhile, his lawyer claimed he was innocent of all the charges.

307.title: UP sees 54.18% voter turnout till 5pm in final phase of Assembly polls
307.article_body: Uttar Pradesh recorded a voter turnout of 54.18% till 5 pm in the seventh and the final phase of the Assembly elections on Monday. PM Narendra Modi's parliamentary seat Varanasi saw 52.79% polling in this period. Fifty-four seats spread across nine districts -- Azamgarh, Mau, Jaunpur, Ghazipur, Chandauli, Varanasi, Mirzapur, Bhadohi and Sonbhadra -- voted on Monday.

308.title: To be part of it is achievement: Boman on pic with Big B, Anupam
308.article_body: Actor Boman Irani on Monday took to Instagram to share a picture with veteran actors Amitabh Bachchan, Anupam Kher and Danny Denzongpa. Boman captioned it, "To be part of this iconic picture is an achievement in itself." The actor further wrote that being a part of the upcoming film 'Uunchai' makes his heart glow with humble pride.

309.title: What we've so far in H'wood is stereotypical: Spider-Man's Zoha Rahman
309.article_body: Actress Zoha Rahman, the first Marvel film character to wear a hijab in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home', has said that what we have seen of South Asian actors in Hollywood is very stereotypical. "Firstly, you don't see more than one South Asian on-screen because it either has to be a South Asian or black or East Asian," the actress added.

310.title: Paytm's market cap falls below ₹50,000 cr as shares hit record low
310.article_body: The market capitalisation of Paytm's parent One97 Communications fell below ₹50,000 crore on Monday as the company's shares hit record low of ₹751. Paytm's market capitalisation stood at ₹48,785 crore as its shares ended 4.15% lower on the NSE on March 7. Paytm made its stock market debut in November 2021 and its shares have declined nearly 65% since then.

311.title: From size zero to size 16, I've enjoyed every phase of life: Kareena
311.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor has said that going from size zero to size 16, she has thoroughly lived and enjoyed every phase of her life. The actress further said that during her pregnancy, she gained 25 kgs of weight but never allowed that to interfere with doing the things that she loves. "I've had...fun being confident in my skin," Kareena added.

312.title: Sachin Bansal's Navi to file for ₹4,000-cr IPO this week: Report
312.article_body: Financial services company Navi Technologies is planning to file draft papers with SEBI for ₹4,000-crore initial public offer (IPO) this week, PTI reported. The issue is expected to open in June and will be a fresh issuance of equity shares with no offer-for-sale component. Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal co-founded Navi with Ankit Agarwal after exiting the e-commerce startup in 2018.

313.title: Yemen's Houthi rebels fire at least 1 missile in Red Sea: US Navy
313.article_body: US Navy on Monday said Yemen's Houthi rebels fired at least one missile in Red Sea on Saturday, March 5. "Although maritime traffic was not impacted, these actions are destabilising and present a danger to all vessels," added the navy. Iran-backed rebel group has fired missiles, bombs in the sea since it seized Yemen's capital Sana'a in 2014.

314.title: China plans to use reusable rockets for manned space missions: Report
314.article_body: China Aerospace Science and Technology (CASC), a state-owned firm plans to use reusable rockets to carry country's new Shenzhou spacecraft for manned missions, reported Space.com. As per the report, the reusable rocket will come in two variants, two-stage for manned missions and three-stage for deep space voyages. Reportedly, tethered landing devices will be deployed during rocket's landing phase.

315.title: Megalodon may have grown to larger sizes in cooler waters: US study
315.article_body: US study revealed Otodus Megalodon, world's largest shark that lived upto 3.6 million years ago may have grown to larger sizes in cooler waters than in warmer areas. "Our findings suggest a previously unrecognised body size pattern following a geography-driven ecological pattern..." said study co-author Kenshu Shimada. Team added the species that lived in cooler areas were 18-20 metres long.

316.title: AAP likely to sweep Punjab, BJP to retain Uttar Pradesh: Exit Polls
316.article_body: Exit polls said AAP will form government in Punjab with India Today-Axis poll predicting 76-90 seats, while News24-Today's Chanakya giving it 89-111 seats. For UP, exit polls predicted a return to power for BJP with NewsX and Republic P-Marq exit polls predicting over 200 seats for the party. Axis poll predicted BJP win in Uttarakhand while CVoter predicted Congress' lead.

317.title: Djokovic contacts Ukrainian tennis player Sergiy to offer help; he shares chat
317.article_body: Novak Djokovic reached out to Ukrainian former world number 31 tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky and offered financial support and any other help required by him amid the Russia-Ukraine war. Stakhovsky posted a screenshot on Instagram of his conversation with Djokovic via WhatsApp, where Djokovic asked him, "Stako, how are you man?...Thinking of you...hoping all calms down soon."

318.title: Second copyright case filed against Dua Lipa's 'Levitating'
318.article_body: A second copyright lawsuit has been filed against singer Dua Lipa's song 'Levitating' in a Manhattan federal court. Songwriters L Russell Brown and Sandy Linzer accused Dua of copying the opening melody of 'Levitating' from their 1979 song 'Wiggle and Giggle All Night' and 1980 song 'Don Diablo'. Earlier band Artikal Sound System accused her of stealing their 2017 song.

319.title: My career is made up of roles that were rejected by others: Swara
319.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker has said that her filmography is made up of roles that were rejected by other actresses. "In 'Raanjhanaa', I was the last person to be cast because they had a sudden last-minute cancellation," Swara stated. "[In] 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo', no actress wanted to play actor Salman Khan's sister, so they reached out to me," she added.

320.title: NZ know what's coming up: Devine ahead of Women's WC game vs India
320.article_body: Ahead of upcoming New Zealand-India match in 2022 Women's World Cup, New Zealand captain Sophie Devine said her side knows what's coming up. The match will be played on Thursday. Last month, New Zealand defeated India in a one-off T20I and 4-1 in a five-match ODI series in Queenstown. Earlier today, New Zealand beat Bangladesh by nine wickets.

321.title: Improve laws governing military engagement with nations: China's Xi
321.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Monday told the military to enhance use of laws in their relations with nations. "Improve the laws and regulations governing military engagement with foreign countries," said Xi, who is also the Commander-in-Chief for the country's military forces. The remarks came during a meeting with the representatives of military in parliament.

322.title: I got breast surgery at 15-16, that was very scary: Rakhi Sawant
322.article_body: Actress Rakhi Sawant has said that she underwent breast surgery when she was around 15-16 years old, adding it was very scary. "I was a kid and totally flat...So I [lay] down in an operation theatre and became a cold-to-hot girl," she added. Rakhi further said that at the time she was told it was important to enter Bollywood.

323.title: Squid Game's Lee Jung Jae wins best actor at Independent Spirit Awards
323.article_body: South Korean actor Lee Jung Jae has won the Best Male Performance in a New Scripted Series award at the Independent Spirit Awards 2022 for his role in 'Squid Game'. He had earlier become the first Korean male actor to win the award for Outstanding Performance by an Actor in a Drama Series at the 28th Screen Actors Guild Awards.

324.title: Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth hospitalised after having fever, vertigo
324.article_body: Veteran actor Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwaryaa on Monday took to Instagram to share a picture of her in the hospital along with neurosurgeon Dr Prithika Chary. She wrote, "Life before covid and post covid. Back again in the hospital experiencing fever and vertigo and what not!" Aishwaryaa had tested positive for COVID-19 last month and had to be hospitalised.

325.title: 11-yr-old Ukraine boy with phone number written on hand travels 1,000 km alone
325.article_body: An 11-year-old boy from Ukraine's Zaporizhzhya covered over 1,000 km alone to reach Slovakia amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. With one plastic bag, passport, his mother's note and a phone number written on his hand, he travelled alone because his parents reportedly had to take care of a sick relative in Ukraine. He was supposed to find his relatives in Slovakia.

326.title: Very odd reaction: Benedict on Sam Elliott's 'The Power...' criticism
326.article_body: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch has reacted to actor Sam Elliott's criticism of Benedict's film 'The Power of the Dog'. "I'm trying...hard not to say anything about a very odd reaction that happened the other day on a radio podcast," Benedict stated without taking Sam's name. This comes after Sam had called Benedict's film "a piece of s**t" on a podcast.

327.title: Telangana has proved to be India's economic powerhouse: TRS leader
327.article_body: Telangana has proved to be the economic powerhouse of the country, CM K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter and TRS leader Kavitha Kalvakuntla said on Monday. "When Telangana was formed in 2014, we had to re-orient and re-invent...state...we started with...budget of ₹1 lakh crore which is today at ₹2.56 lakh crore," she added. We've made tremendous progress across sectors, she further said.

328.title: There were two victims in 'Rust' shooting incident: Alec Baldwin
328.article_body: Actor Alec Baldwin, speaking about the shooting incident on the sets of 'Rust' which killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins in October last year, said that there were two victims in the incident. Talking about the lawsuits filed over the incident, Baldwin stated, "We have people that are suing people that they think are deep pockets litigants."

329.title: In Indian conditions, he's unstoppable: Jaffer on Ravindra Jadeja
329.article_body: Following Ravindra Jadeja's 175* and 9/87 in India-Sri Lanka first Test, Wasim Jaffer said the India all-rounder is unstoppable in home conditions. "Jadeja is arguably one of the best all-rounders in the world...even overseas, he can perform at number seven the way his batting has improved," he added. India are 1-0 ahead in two-match Test series against Sri Lanka.

330.title: I'll not judge Vihari on what he did on Mohali wicket: Gambhir on 1st Test
330.article_body: Following Hanuma Vihari's 58 in his first innings while batting at number three for India in first Test against Sri Lanka, Gautam Gambhir said he'll not judge Vihari based on his performance in Mohali. "I'll judge him on what he has done overall in Test cricket to date because all batters...even Mohammad Shami, looked comfortable on this pitch," he added.

331.title: Assume tough times ahead, be prepared: Zoho CEO to staff amid Russia-Ukraine war
331.article_body: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu on Monday tweeted some advice that he had shared with this staff amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Vembu wrote, "The world faces many serious challenges…While our company is on a...healthy foundation...we have weathered two serious downturns in our 25-year history...Assume...tough times will be ahead and be prepared…We don't know what lies ahead. Expect turbulent times."

332.title: Power outage in Mumbai's Colaba, electricity restored in phases
332.article_body: Days after a massive power failure in parts of Mumbai, Colaba witnessed a power outage on Sunday night. "Yesterday three 11 kilovolt fault occurred in Colaba area, due to this around 19 Distribution Sub Stations (DSS) were affected," the BEST said. Electricity in 70% of areas was restored immediately, while the remaining places took time.

333.title: Choreographer Tushar Kalia announces engagement to Triveni Barman
333.article_body: Choreographer Tushar Kalia, known for judging 'Dance Deewane' along with actress Madhuri Dixit, on Monday announced his engagement to Triveni Barman. Tushar shared a picture with Triveni on social media, writing, "She said yes. Couldn't have asked for anything else on my birthday." Madhuri along with actress Mouni Roy congratulated the couple in the comment section.

334.title: Priest assaults man for entering Hyd temple's 'prohibited' area, held
334.article_body: A priest has been arrested for assaulting a devotee at a temple in Secunderabad after the man reportedly entered a prohibited area. The incident was said to have taken place on February 27 at Ganesh Temple, when the temple was crowded with devotees and temple staff. The priest allegedly yelled at the victim and even beat him up.

335.title: Rao shares post of man in Hyd hospital, says he'll assist him
335.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister Thanneeru Harish Rao on Sunday shared the post of a man hospitalised in Hyderabad with clotting in his brain and said that his "team would assist" him. The post, originally shared online by an MBT spokesperson, had a picture of 36-year-old Mohd Abdul Rizwan in KIMS Secunderabad. It revealed that the patient is being charged ₹1 lakh/day.

336.title: 929 immunisation booths for kids open from today in Gurugram
336.article_body: 929 immunisation booths for children have opened from today across different health centres as part of a week-long immunisation drive in Gurugram, the district health department said. "Vaccines will be given to children up to the age of 16 years," said district immunisation officer Dr MP Singh. Children can get vaccines for diseases like hepatitis-B, rotavirus, polio and Japanese encephalitis.

337.title: Central GST adjudged winner at inter-office athletics meet in Pune
337.article_body: The Poona inter-office athletics meet was held in Pune's Indrayani Nagar on Sunday. The annual event had competitions such as running, shot put and long jump. Central GST's Akshay Khot won both 100m and 200m events for men while Shyamrao Daundkar won the 400m and 800m events. Meanwhile, Chaitrali Gujar, also of Central GST won the women's 100m event.

338.title: Light rain in Pune on March 8 & 9, cloudy conditions to continue: IMD
338.article_body: Pune will receive light rain on March 8 and 9, according to a report by the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Mornings will have partly cloudy conditions, turning to cloudy skies post afternoon hours over Pune and other areas in the coming days, the report added. Other districts that are likely to experience similar conditions include Sindhudurg, Nashik, Jalgaon and Ahmednagar.

339.title: Delhi Police constable beats dog to death with baseball bat; arrested
339.article_body: A Delhi Police constable allegedly beat a stray dog to death with a baseball bat on Sunday night, following which he has been arrested, officials said. The dog would bark at the policeman and his family every time they passed through the neighbourhood and he felt threatened, officials said. Locals alerted the police after the incident.

340.title: There's stage Madhuri, there's another who's homebody: Madhuri Dixit
340.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has said that there is a stage Madhuri who is in front of the camera and there's another Madhuri who is a homebody. "You lose somebody close to you and that sorrow is right there in you. But then you have to go on a set and do a scene that is the complete opposite," Madhuri added.

341.title: As a captain, I want to use Jadeja a lot more with the bat: Rohit
341.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma said he wants to use all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja "a lot more" with the bat. "We all know his bowling and everyone knows about his fielding. To me, he is one of the top (all-rounders) definitely," Rohit stated. Jadeja scored an unbeaten 175 runs and took nine wickets in the first Test match against Sri Lanka.

342.title: Can't tell you anything as I've no idea: Rohit on why Ashwin didn't play Tests in England
342.article_body: Addressing a reporter's query about Ravichandran Ashwin not being a regular in India's playing XI in away Tests, Rohit Sharma said, "I can't tell you anything about his overseas place." He added, "I honestly have no idea. I wasn't part of selection at that time." Notably, Ashwin wasn't included in any of India's away Tests against England last year.

343.title: It's cheating: BJP MLA on Dabbewala Bhavan's location in Mumbai
343.article_body: BJP MLA Ashish Shelar has criticised the Shiv Sena-led BMC for setting up the Dabbewala Bhavan in Mumbai's Khar area, far away from suburban railway station. Taking to Twitter, Shelar claimed that it was set up by closing an existing COVID-19 vaccination centre and that it was "cheating" with dabbewalas. "BJP will erect...new bhavan...when we come to power," he added.

344.title: Father allegedly kills daughter for refusing to marry man of his choice
344.article_body: Indradeo Ram, along with his two brothers, allegedly slit his 19-year-old daughter's throat after she refused to marry the man of Ram's choice. The daughter's body was later dumped at an agricultural field in Bihar's Kotwa village late on Sunday, police said. Kalawati, Ram's wife, said her daughter wanted to marry another boy, with whom she was supposedly in love.

345.title: Philippines raises age of sexual consent from 12 to 16
345.article_body: Philippines has raised age of sexual consent from 12 to 16, President Rodrigo Duterte's office said on Monday. Under new law, sexual activity between adult and person aged 16 or lower will be considered statutory rape. Exceptions will be made for couples aged over 13 if their age difference doesn't exceed three years and sex is proven to be consensual.

346.title: Angelina in Yemen to aid refugees, calls it worst humanitarian crisis
346.article_body: Actress and philanthropist Angelina Jolie took to Instagram to share that she has reached Yemen's Aden amid what she called "one of the worst humanitarian crises in the world." She wrote in her caption, "As we continue to watch the horrors unfolding in Ukraine...I'm here in Yemen to support people who also desperately need peace.

347.title: BJP MLAs suspended from T'gana Assembly on Budget Session's 1st day
347.article_body: All three BJP MLAs were suspended for the rest of the Telangana Legislative Assembly session on the first day of the Budget Session on Monday. The MLAs were charged with disrupting the budget speech. The MLAs, T Raja Singh, M Raghunandan Rao and Eatala Rajender, later protested outside the Assembly against the suspension.

348.title: Apply for a valid licence to operate cabs in Maharashtra: Bombay HC to Ola, Uber
348.article_body:
The Bombay High Court has directed cab aggregators including Uber India and Ola to apply for a licence under Motor Vehicles Aggregator Guidelines, 2020, to ply their cabs in Maharashtra. It is "complete lawlessness" that aggregators are operating without a valid licence, the court observed.
The court has asked aggregators to apply for a new licence by March 16.
