349.title: Maha Council briefly adjourned over call for action against Pune SP
349.article_body: The Maharashtra Legislative Council was adjourned for 10 minutes on Monday after BJP demanded action against Pune SP Abhinav Deshmukh. BJP member Gopichand Padalkar questioned the SP's decision of transferring a constable on the grounds of him having an extramarital affair. "How can the transfer order mention the woman's name...when [it's] regarding the constable", he said.

350.title: He was soft-spoken, made me feel comfortable: Girl who interacted with PM in Pune
350.article_body: Seven-year-old Shreya Gadhve described her interaction with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his Sunday ride in the Pune Metro as "short but memorable". Gadhve, who's a student of Poona School for Blind Girls, said the PM was very humble and "soft-spoken" and made her feel comfortable. "Modiji even complimented me for my dress," she added.

351.title: Man Utd can't drop any more points in Premier League: Ralf Rangnick
351.article_body: Following a 4-1 loss against Manchester City, Manchester United head coach Ralf Rangnick has said that his side cannot drop points in the Premier League to have a chance for a top-four finish. "We also know that in those 10 games...we have to play, there are a few other difficult ones so let's take it game by game," Rangnick stated.

352.title: There's no contest in Varanasi South, people will elect BJP: MLA
352.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister Neelkanth Tiwari, who is also the incumbent MLA from Varanasi South, said on Monday that there's "no fierce battle" in constituency, adding that people will elect BJP. Tiwari stated that people of Varanasi share special bond with PM Narendra Modi, who has authorised several developmental works. Polling for last phase of UP Assembly elections was held today.

353.title: SP-SBSP will win 45-47 seats in Purvanchal region: SBSP chief
353.article_body: The SP-SBSP alliance in Uttar Pradesh "will win 45-47 seats in the Purvanchal region", said SBSP chief OP Rajbhar. "We're winning on five of eight seats in Varanasi, three of four seats in Chandauli, seven of nine seats in Jaunpur," he added. BJP and BSP won't win a single seat in Ballia, Mau, Azamgarh, Ambedkar Nagar and Ghazipur, he said.

354.title: Setting an example for sportswomen across globe: Smriti on Pak's Bismah
354.article_body: Praising Bismah Maroof for returning to playing cricket post giving birth to a baby girl, India Women opener Smriti Mandhana said Pakistan Women captain is setting an example for sportswomen across the globe. "Coming back post pregnancy in six months...playing international cricket is so inspiring," she added. India beat Pakistan by 107 runs in their 2022 Women's World Cup opener.

355.title: Rafael Nadal can do anything he wants on the court: Marcos Giron
355.article_body: American tennis player Marcos Giron said that he was surprised by Rafael Nadal's shot selection during their match in the Australian Open 2022. "You feel that Nadal can do anything that he wants on the court but he always makes the right decision," Giron added. Nadal defeated Giron 6-1, 6-4, 6-2 in the first round of the Australian Open 2022.

356.title: SC to hear plea by UPSC aspirants for extra attempt on March 21
356.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday said it will hear a plea on March 21 filed by UPSC aspirants who had missed their civil services exam due to COVID-19 and sought an additional attempt. It adjourned the matter after UPSC counsel sought time to seek instruction on the issue. The court asked parties concerned to file an affidavit on the plea.

357.title: Samsung Galaxy devices' source code breached by hackers
357.article_body: Samsung Electronics on Monday said that it suffered a cybersecurity breach that exposed the company's internal data, including source code for the operation of its Galaxy smartphones. Samsung didn't identify the hackers, however, it said measures to prevent further breaches have been put in place. The hack doesn't include the personal information of consumers or employees, Samsung said.

358.title: 2 Muslim men beaten up in Gurugram's Sector 45: Police
358.article_body: Gurugram Police on Monday said two Muslim men were allegedly beaten up by two unidentified men near Ramada Hotel in Gurugram's Sector 45 on Sunday night. The victims alleged that the accused made derogatory remarks on their religion and snatched their phones. One of the victims alleged that the accused forcibly put a white powdery substance in his mouth.

359.title: Low voter turnout in UP due to improper arrangements: Cong leader
359.article_body: Congress leader Ajay Rai on Monday alleged the voter turnout was low in the last phase of Uttar Pradesh elections due to lack of proper arrangements by the administration. "Not many people can be seen...unlike earlier elections," he claimed after casting his vote in Varanasi. "People are forced to stand in the open...[they] don't seem to be excited," he added.

360.title: Drunk bouncer abuses, beats up petrol pump worker in Mumbai; held
360.article_body: A drunk man, who is a bouncer by profession, allegedly beat up a petrol pump employee in Mumbai's Kandivali around 4 am on Monday. After filling the petrol, the employee asked the bouncer to be seated in the car but he didn't listen and instead assaulted the petrol pump employee. The accused also hurled abuses and slurs at him.

361.title: Video shows 2 Ukrainian soldiers getting married amid war with Russia
361.article_body: Amid the ongoing situation in Ukraine, a video has surfaced on social media that showed a pair of soldiers getting married near Kyiv. The video showed Lesya and Valeriy in military uniform and surrounded by other soldiers as they sang local songs. Vitali Klitschko, Kyiv's mayor and former world heavyweight boxing champion, also visited the area to congratulate the couple.

362.title: Prez Kovind to award Nari Shakti Puraskars to 29 women tomorrow
362.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind will confer the Nari Shakti Puraskars on 29 outstanding individuals for 2020 and 2021 on International Women's Day on Tuesday. "These achievers have not allowed age, geographical barriers or access to resources to come in the way of fulfilling their dreams," a statement by the Ministry of Women and Child Development said.

363.title: New Zealand imposes sanctions on Russian PM, President Putin
363.article_body: New Zealand Foreign Ministry on Monday introduced travel bans against Russian President Vladimir Putin, PM Mikhail Mishustin and 100 other leaders. As per ministry, PM Jacinda Ardern also announced targeted travel bans against top Russian officials including Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. Government also said it will bring a law to impose first-ever sanctions against any country.

364.title: Grammarly, founded by Ukrainians, to donate all money made in Russia since 2014
364.article_body: Typing assistant Grammarly, whose Co-founders are Ukrainians, is donating all of the money it earned from Russia and Belarus, since the war started in 2014 through 2022, to causes supporting Ukraine. Grammarly will donate $5 million to organisations and funds defending and supporting the people of Ukraine. "We have many team members who call Ukraine home," the company said.

365.title: Indian investors lose ₹29 lakh cr wealth since February, more than Ukraine's GDP
365.article_body: Indian investors have lost ₹29 lakh crore of wealth since the beginning of February amid heightening geopolitical tensions between Russia and Ukraine and oil prices touching a 13-year high. The wealth lost by Indian investors is a lot more than Ukraine's GDP, which was estimated at $181 billion (nearly ₹15 lakh crore) in 2021, according to the Statista website.

366.title: Europe still has room for further sanctions against Russia: France
366.article_body: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire on Monday said Europe and France still have room to implement further sanctions against Russia for invading Ukraine last month. "Yes there are margins for manoeuvre. All options are on the table," Le Maire added. Till date, European Union (EU) has imposed three packages of sanctions including freezing assets of Russian central bank.

367.title: Bengaluru recorded 146 new COVID cases, 2 deaths on March 6
367.article_body: Karnataka's Bengaluru on Sunday recorded 146 new COVID-19 cases and two coronavirus-related deaths in the last 24 hours. Data shared by the BBMP shows total 138 people recovered from the virus or were discharged on March 6, Sunday. The data also revealed that a total of 27,402 COVID-19 vaccination doses were administered in the city in the last 24 hours.

368.title: MS Dhoni begins preparations for IPL 2022 in Surat, CSK share pics
368.article_body: With IPL 2022 set to begin on March 26, CSK took to Instagram to share a few stories of the team's training session. In the stories, MS Dhoni can be seen preparing for the tournament. The CSK captain along with a few players including Ambati Rayudu had reached Surat last week. CSK will take on KKR in the tournament's opener.

369.title: That's the only thing I didn't like: Khawaja on Pak fans cheering his dismissal
369.article_body: Talking about his experience of playing in Pakistan, Australia's Usman Khawaja expressed his gratitude towards Islamabad for their hospitality. Khawaja, however, also jokingly said the only thing that he didn't like was when the crowd cheered after he got out for 97 during their first innings in the ongoing Test. "[Everyone] cheered when DRS showed I was out," he stated.

370.title: NASA studies 50-year-old lunar rock samples to plan a return to Moon
370.article_body: NASA is set to analyse the last, sealed lunar rock samples from 50 years ago to know more about the Moon and plan a return to its surface. Last month, scientists started the process by extracting lunar gases stored inside a container housing samples. NASA said team will analyse soil, rocks from the container after gas extraction process is completed.

371.title: Coal India plans to become net-zero emitter in 3-4 years: Chairman
371.article_body: Coal India Chairman, Pramod Agrawal on Monday said the government-owned mining company plans to become net-zero carbon emitter in three to four years. During the 15th Indian Coal Markets Conference, Agrawal said the firm's renewable energy projects, cleaner transport and greater internal energy efficiency are expected to contribute to the target. India aims to achieve net-zero target by 2070.

372.title: Hyderabad to get its 1st female SHO on International Women's Day
372.article_body: Hyderabad Police is set to appoint their first female Station House Officer (SHO) on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday, Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand said. He added that the police will appoint more women to their workforce in the coming days. "We hope that of...total police force, 20-30%...are female constables and sub-inspectors," Anand further said.

373.title: Indian refuses to leave Ukraine without his pet panther & jaguar
373.article_body: Orthopaedic doctor Girikumar Patil, popularly known as Jaguar Kumar, who hails from India's Andhra Pradesh has refused to leave Ukraine without his pet jaguar and panther. Saying that he didn't get a "proper response" when he contacted the Indian embassy, Kumar added, "Until my last moment I'll...protect them. There's no way I'll leave the kids (his pets) behind."

374.title: Oil prices touch highest level since 2008, jump close to $140 mark
374.article_body: Oil prices continued to soar on Monday after reports said the US and European allies are planning to ban Russian oil imports over its invasion of Ukraine. In the first few minutes of trade on Monday, Brent crude hit $139.13/barrel while West Texas Intermediate hit $130.50/barrel, both at their highest since July 2008. Russia is the world's second-largest crude exporter.

375.title: Delhi Transport Minister launches 100 new AC CNG buses today
375.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot launched 100 more air-conditioned low-floor buses, which will run on compressed natural gas (CNG) and a new electric bus from the Delhi Transport Corporation's (DTC) Indraprastha depot today. The new AC CNG buses will include facilities such as CCTV cameras, panic buttons for women's safety and more, according to transport officials.

376.title: Last batch of 6,177 evacuated Indian students arrive from Budapest
376.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri along with the last batch of 6,177 Indian students from Budapest reached Delhi on Monday. "There is joy, enthusiasm and relief as youngsters reach home and will soon be with their parents and families," Puri wrote on Twitter. Over 16,000 Indian students have been evacuated from Ukraine over the past week.

377.title: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra refused to identify former colleague Subramanian: CBI tells court
377.article_body: The CBI has been granted seven-day custody of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna in the co-location case after she was arrested on Sunday. The CBI had sought 14-day custody from the court arguing that Ramkrishna had been evasive in her replies and despite being confronted with her former colleague Anand Subramanian, a co-accused, she "refused to even identify him."

378.title: Ukraine's fight against Russia an inspiration for us: Taiwan minister
378.article_body: Ukrainians fighting the Russian invasion of their country are an inspiration for the Taiwanese people, Taiwan Foreign Minister Joseph Wu said on Monday. Wu added that Taiwan has raised over $10.6 million (over ₹81 crore) in donations to help displaced Ukrainians. Additionally, Taiwanese leaders, including President Tsai, had contributed a month's pay towards humanitarian efforts in Ukraine.

379.title: Man held for allegedly trying to run over judge's wife in Ayodhya
379.article_body: A 45-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly tried to run over a judge's wife and driver following an argument over parking in Ayodhya. The driver alleged that "when they reached the school to pick judge's daughter, the accused attempted to run over them in his SUV". A case was lodged against Manuj Malhotra on charges of attempt to murder.

380.title: I don't think I've ability to write, I'm fascinated by people who can: Shahid
380.article_body: When asked whether he has thought about writing or directing a film just like his father Pankaj Kapur, actor Shahid Kapoor said, "I don't think I have the ability to write. I'm fascinated by people who can." "As for direction, I am very focussed on what I am doing...I am not ready to give up acting right now," Shahid added.

381.title: We have ensured that Fadnavis never return as CM: Sharad Pawar
381.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar took a dig at former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis at an event in Osmanabad. "Some people don't know that politics should not be done during difficult times. Before elections, only he [Fadnavis] was saying that he will be back as CM," Pawar said. "Now, we have ensured that he will never return as CM," added Pawar.

382.title: Mumbai Police arrest gangster with 37 cases against him in B'luru
382.article_body: A man with 37 cases registered against him including serious offences such as murder, has been arrested from Bengaluru, Karnataka. The Criminal Intelligence Unit (CIU) of the Mumbai crime branch arrested Iliyas Abdul Aziz Khan alias Iliyas Bachakana from a hotel in Hosur after he was found hiding there. Other cases against him include attempt to murder, robbery and extortion.

383.title: Radhe Shyam isn't inspired by Titanic, it's a different story: Pooja Hegde
383.article_body: Speaking about the comparisons between her film 'Radhe Shyam' and 'Titanic', actress Pooja Hegde said that it's a big compliment to achieve that scale and be like it. She added, "But, Radhe Shyam is not inspired by Titanic. It's a different story." "The only similarity is the ship in the middle of the sea, and something is happening," Pooja said.

384.title: S Korean actress Han So-hee's agency responds to mom's fraud case
384.article_body: South Korean actress Han So-hee's agency responded to fraud case involving her mother, stating she won't take responsibility for the debt. Her mother had opened a bank account in her name when she was a minor and used it to borrow money without her knowledge. "There was even a case involving the forgery of a private document," the agency stated.

385.title: Shabana shares pic of Javed's 'cluttered' desk, says he uses trolley to write on
385.article_body: Shabana Azmi took to Instagram and shared a picture of Javed Akhtar's "cluttered" study table. "Javed's study. Always so cluttered that he has to use a food trolley (peaking from right-hand corner) to write on instead of his desk," she wrote. Reacting to her post, a user wrote, "The genius' desk," while another user wrote, "I'm feeling dizzy looking at...table."

386.title: Actors have come & gone, junior artists remain in every frame: Big B
386.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan took to his blog to praise the work of junior artists in the film industry, writing, "Actors and actresses have come and gone but they remain in every frame!" The actor shared a series of pictures showing his interaction with the artists. He further wrote that some of them have been around since before he began his journey.

387.title: ED, CBI take action on people before they join BJP: Mumbai Mayor
387.article_body: Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar criticised BJP for allegedly using central agencies to settle political scores. "ED, CBI and IT Dept take action against people and if they join BJP, they get clean," said Pednekar. The reaction is part of her verbal spat with BJP MLA Nitesh Rane who was recently interrogated by Mumbai Police in connection with Disha Salian's death.

388.title: Microplastics found in fish caught off Mumbai coast: Study
388.article_body: Researchers have found microplastics less than 100 microns in size in gastrointestinal tracts and gills of croaker fish caught off Mumbai’s coast. According to the Central Institute of Fisheries Education (CIFE) research, the microplastics found in fish tissue were predominantly black and blue in colour. It poses a carcinogenic risk to consumers and organisms in food chain, the study added.

389.title: MG introduces the all-new ZS EV seeking to change mindsets about EVs
389.article_body: The recently launched ZS EV features a 50.3 kWh advanced battery with 176PS of power and driving range of 461 km* in a single charge, MG revealed. It is equipped with LED headlamps, a 10.1” HD infotainment screen, and digital Bluetooth key while its advanced safety package includes blind-spot detection, lane change assist and rear cross-traffic alert.

390.title: 10 students of UP polytechnic college injured in gas cylinder blast at hostel
390.article_body: Ten students were injured in a gas cylinder explosion inside the hostel of a government polytechnic college in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr on Monday, police said. The incident took place when a five-kilogram cylinder exploded while food was being cooked inside the kitchen, police added. Bulandshahr DM said the injured persons have been sent to a government medical college in Aligarh.

391.title: Anamika is my evil twin: Madhuri on her character in 'The Fame Game'
391.article_body: When asked about her character 'Anamika Anand' in show 'The Fame Game', actress Madhuri Dixit said her on-screen character differs from her real self. Madhuri added 'Anamika' wouldn't be able to deal with things as she does. "She'd be a mess if she walks into a room and nobody recognises her, she'll go mad. She's...my evil twin," Madhuri said.

392.title: Capt Amarinder Singh meets Amit Shah ahead of Punjab polls result
392.article_body: Punjab Lok Congress President Captain Amarinder Singh met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi on Monday. When quipped on the alliance's performance in Punjab assembly elections, Singh said, "My party and BJP has done well. Let us see what happens." The PLC is in an alliance with BJP along with Shiromani Akali Dal (Sanyukt) for the Punjab polls.

393.title: Traffic rules' violators in Noida to get e-fines from April 15
393.article_body: Commuters violating traffic rules in Noida will be issued electronic fines from April 15, 2022, as part of the Noida authority's intelligent traffic management system (ITMS) project. A budget of ₹64.49 crore has been set aside for the project, which will put 84 traffic intersections under e-surveillance in the city with a total of 1,065 cameras, officials said.

394.title: Ukraine rejects humanitarian corridors leading to Russia & Belarus, calls it 'immoral'
394.article_body: Ukraine has rejected humanitarian corridors proposed by Russia that allowed people to exit to Russia and Belarus. President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's spokesperson called the move "immoral" and said Russia was trying to "use people's suffering to create a television picture". "They are citizens of Ukraine, they should have the right to evacuate to the territory of Ukraine," the spokesperson added.

395.title: What is the co-location case for which ex-NSE CEO Chitra has been arrested?
395.article_body: The NSE co-location case refers to a series of events wherein some brokers received preferential access through the co-location facility, resulting in faster access to the markets. The matter came to light after a whistleblower wrote to SEBI in 2015. The NSE co-location facilities were launched in 2009 while Chitra Ramkrishna was appointed as the Joint MD the same year.

396.title: Want him to go through journey without my backing: Salil Ankola on son's career
396.article_body: Actor Salil Ankola said he wants his son Karan Ankola to go through the journey of making his career without his backing. "When you achieve success after struggling for it relentlessly, you feel proud of yourself. I am very happy that his efforts are always getting noticed and appreciated," 'The Power' actor said.

397.title: IMD predicts overcast weather, rainfall in Delhi on March 9-10
397.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted overcast weather and light rainfall in Delhi on March 9 and 10. During this period, light rainfall is also expected in districts of Punjab and Haryana. The rainfall will be due to the western disturbance that is likely to affect the Western Himalayan region from the night of March 8.

398.title: Kangana celebrates 8 yrs of 'Queen'; shares old pic with Virat, Dhoni
398.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories on Monday to share a post celebrating eight years of her film 'Queen'. She shared a throwback picture, wherein she's seen doing a step from the song 'London Thumakda' with Virat Kohli, MS Dhoni, Ajinkya Rahane, Ravichandran Ashwin and Stuart Binny. "On this day...a film came called Queen...and it changed my life," Kangana wrote.

399.title: May God keep you safe: Kirron Kher wishes husband Anupam on 67th b'day
399.article_body: Actor-politician Kirron Kher wished her husband-actor, Anupam Kher, on his 67th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Kirron shared a picture with Anupam from an event and captioned it, "Many many happy returns of the day dearest @anupampkher, husband, friend, support and my love. God bless you and keep you safe and healthy always."

400.title: Warne's cricket knowledge separated him from everyone else: Clarke
400.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52 on Friday, former Australia captain Michael Clarke told The Sydney Morning Herald, "Warne's knowledge around the game separated him from everyone else I played with." "Warne lived his life at such a fast pace that he nearly created this invincible feeling around him," he added.

401.title: Was told I'll be made Prez if I didn't speak in favour of protesting farmers: Malik
401.article_body: Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik has claimed that 'some of his friends' in the BJP told him that he will be given the post of India's President if he didn't speak in support of farmers protesting against the three farm laws. "They tried to lure me...but I turned down all their proposals and spoke in favour of farmers," said Malik.

402.title: People say, 'Oh God, we want to work you' and then nothing happens: Shefali
402.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said she gets a lot of appreciation for her performances but that doesn't translate into work offers. She added, "[People say] 'Oh god we want to work with you'. 'Really? I want to work with you too' and then nothing happens." "Then I see [them] at...next party and say the exactly same thing...It's really boring," she said.
